Articles.Content: Any thoughts of adding tweakscale support?  It could really cut down the part list for those with lots of mods.

~~any chance to get this updated in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>?~~

Sorry. just saw that this is mentioned in the the tittle section of the first post...

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-19T19:00:34Z" title="02/19/2017 07:00  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 19, 2017</time> by Felson**

> 
> 
> On 2/18/2017 at 8:18 PM, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> Any thoughts of adding tweakscale support?  It could really cut down the part list for those with lots of mods.
> 

yea but they should show up in their own category, so you shouldn't have to scroll through a huge part list to find them nor should they contribute to a huge part list

They do have their own category, I've been trying to cut down on the number of mods and parts I'm using because I'm tired of it taking 2-3 minutes to load to the main menu.  I finally just deleted everything but the 1.25 version for each planet, and am going to attempt to create a tweakscale config for them.

> 
> 
> On 21/02/2017 at 10:21 PM, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> They do have their own category, I've been trying to cut down on the number of mods and parts I'm using because I'm tired of it taking 2-3 minutes to load to the main menu.  I finally just deleted everything but the 1.25 version for each planet, and am going to attempt to create a tweakscale config for them.
> 

That will only affect the size, they also have different stats so you will lose that

> 
> 
> 32 minutes ago, JoePatrick1 said:
> 
> 
> That will only affect the size, they also have different stats so you will lose that
> 

I'm not too worried about the heavy payload vs high altitude vs standard, i elected to just save the standard version.  My main concern is if Tweakscale is going to scale the lifting force or not, been so caught up in doing other stuff, still haven't tried it yet.  Right now I dont have many use-cases for the balloons, but they are so cool I don't want to get rid of them altogether.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> I'm not too worried about the heavy payload vs high altitude vs standard, i elected to just save the standard version.  My main concern is if Tweakscale is going to scale the lifting force or not, been so caught up in doing other stuff, still haven't tried it yet.  Right now I dont have many use-cases for the balloons, but they are so cool I don't want to get rid of them altogether.
> 

Even between the different sizes of standard they have different stats.The lifting force will not be scaled as this is defined in the cfg

Got something pretty cool I will be sharing soon (like later today/tomorrow soon)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-24T18:38:51Z" title="02/24/2017 06:38  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 24, 2017</time> by JoePatrick1**

Well here it is.  

The texture and scanning laser effect are completely placeholder but here is a little preview of what's to come

Over the next few days I'll hopefully have some more to show

![5nnvh4q.gif](http://i.imgur.com/5nnvh4q.gif)
Looks nice!

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> Looks nice!
> 

Thanks, I hope to be adding more animated parts in. Next up is the KerBalloons Flight Computer
Does this work on 1.2.2?

nice! Already have the stock atmosphere analyzer in development but that will make a good stepping stone to this atmo science instrument! Flight computer will be great as I move into kOS use... good stuff keep it up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
posted a github issue, exceptions on loading from the service bays.

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, eberkain said:
> 
> 
> posted a github issue, exceptions on loading from the service bays.
> 

Haven't seen this before. 2 reasons I can think of:

- KB might not be 100% compatible with 1.2**.2** (assuming that's what you're using)
- Could be an issue with the install.

Have you tried on a clean install?

> 
> 
> 18 hours ago, Drew Kerman said:
> 
> 
> nice! Already have the stock atmosphere analyzer in development but that will make a good stepping stone to this atmo science instrument! Flight computer will be great as I move into kOS use... good stuff keep it up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Busy week this week but hopefully I can get it out some time in March along with the flight computer (which comes with the hover mode) and maybe an extra experiment or two

> Sorry, on mobile, couldn't remove this ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")
> 

Sorry for the lack of updates, busy time of year with exams coming up, not sure if I will be able to get the update before then but if not then I have 3 months off and the next update will be a big one.

-Jool Balloons  

-Flight computer (with hover mode)  

-New science experiments  

-Contracts (hopefully)

### 
Awesome poster by [@DiscoSlelge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/114099-discoslelge/) from this [thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/158860-my-missions-patches-ksp-illustrations/&page=2#comment-3064007)

![1495449307-affiche-jool.jpg](http://image.noelshack.com/fichiers/2017/21/1495449307-affiche-jool.jpg)
Tried loading this mod with 1.3 and the game crashes every time. We'll have to wait for an update.
